intro: Stephania grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered stephania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow or greenish-yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Stephania grandiflora is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
